headline: FDA device recall of Sedecal SP-HF 4.0 Portable X‑Ray System – no federal healthcare billing fraud identified
reason: The record describes a product recall issued by the FDA for a medical device that failed to meet U.S. performance standards.  There is no mention of Medicare, Medicaid or any federal healthcare program billing, nor any indication of false claims, kickbacks, upcoding, or other fraud types.  Consequently the case does not meet the criteria for a qui tam action under the False Claims Act.
key_facts: Sedecal SP-HF 4.0 Portable X‑Ray System recalled for non‑compliance with U.S. performance standards
Recall reason: insufficient source‑skin distance and missing tube manufacturer label
Recalling firm: Sedecal USA, Inc

original_row.text:
SOURCE: FDA Device Recalls

PRODUCT: Sedecal SP-HF 4.0 Portable X-Ray System; Manufactured by SEDECAL, C/Pelya 9 Pol. Ind. Rio De Janeiro, 28110 Algete (Madrid) Spain
RECALL REASON: A minimum source-skin-distance of less than 30 cm and not identifying the tube manufacturer on the tube housing label resulted in the SP-HF-4.0 Portable Systems not complying with the U.S. Federal performance standard.
CLASSIFICATION: 
STATUS: Terminated
RECALLING FIRM: Sedecal USA, Inc
RECALL DATE:

headline: Device recall for a defective cervical post – no evidence of false claims or federal program billing fraud

Recall classified as terminated, no ongoing enforcement action
No mention of billing or claims to federal healthcare programs

original_row.text:
SOURCE: FDA Device Recalls

PRODUCT: GE 4 inch Anterior Cervical Post, GE Part Number 1006385 or 1006385-NAV, GE Healthcare OEC Medical Systems (an accessory used with the InstaTrak 3500 plus and 9800 C-Arm Navigation systems)
RECALL REASON: Weld defect- the weld between the post body and the screw was not properly formed and can fail, even when minimal force is used.

headline: FDA device recall of Bio‑Logic camera pole assemblies – no federal healthcare billing fraud identified
reason: The record describes a product recall issued by the FDA for a medical device. No mention of Medicare, Medicaid, or any federal healthcare program billing is present, and there is no evidence of false claims or other fraud. The lack of federal program involvement places the case in the "not viable" category.
key_facts: Bio‑Logic Systems Corp issued a recall for telescoping camera pole assemblies.
Recall reason: pole may weaken and detach, potentially causing injury.
No reference to Medicare/Medicaid billing or claims.

original_row.text:
SOURCE: FDA Device Recalls

PRODUCT: Bio-logic System Corp --Telescoping Camera Pole Assembly (part number 585-CYBPSM and 580-VIDPOL) and assemblies (580IPCART and 580 PNCART; Bio-Logic Systems Corporation, Mundelein, IL 60060; The Model 580-VIDPOL is used with the 580-PNCART that is wired for use with a Panasonic Camera.  The pole is also a subassembly of the 585-CYBPSM with wires used in the 580-IPCART wired for the use with an Ipela Camera.  Both carts are a component of the Ceegraph/Sleepscan Netlink with Video.
RECALL REASON: Bio-logic System Corp Camera Pole may weaken and detach at the base of the telescoping camera pole during transport causing pole to break at the welded base and fall.
CLASSIFICATION: 
STATUS: Terminated
RECALLING FIRM: Bio-Logic Systems Corp
RECALL DATE:

headline: Device recall for a Philips CT scanner software – no evidence of federal healthcare program fraud
reason: The record describes an FDA device recall for a Philips CT scanner software issue. There is no mention of Medicare, Medicaid, or any federal healthcare program billing. The recall pertains to a safety defect rather than false claims or kickbacks, and no evidence of fraudulent billing is provided. Consequently, the case does not meet the criteria for a viable qui tam action.
key_facts: Philips Medical Systems North America Co. issued a recall for the NeuViz Dual Multi-Slice CT Scanner System software.
Recall reason: timed scan application does not wait for programmed interval before starting x‑ray.
Status: terminated; no mention of billing or reimbursement issues.
implicated_actors: Philips Medical Systems North America Co.

original_row.text:
SOURCE: FDA Device Recalls

PRODUCT: NeuViz Dual Multi-Slice Computed Tomography (CT) Scanner System (software).

Whole body x-ray computed tomography scanner which features a continuously rotating tube-detector system and functions according to the fan beam principle. The system software is an interactive program used for x-ray scan control, image reconstruction, and image archive/evaluation. It is intended to produce cross-section images of head and body by computer reconstruction of x-ray transmission data taken at different angles. The function of Time Scan is intended to use in contrast scan include single phase and multi-phase scan, that is according to different density of contrast in vessels or organs between different phase to get necessary information to support doctor's diagnosis.
RECALL REASON: An issue associated with the "Timed Scan" application was found.  The system does not wait for the programmed time interval and starts the x-ray after selection of the scan button when certain criteria is met.
CLASSIFICATION: 
STATUS: Terminated
RECALLING FIRM: Philips Medical Systems North America Co. Phillips
RECALL DATE:

headline: Device recall of Penumbra Neuron Delivery Catheter – no evidence of false claims or federal program billing fraud
reason: The record describes a product recall due to mechanical failure, with no mention of Medicare/Medicaid billing, false claims, or fraudulent activity. Without federal program involvement or evidence of improper billing, the case does not meet criteria for a qui tam action.
key_facts: Penumbra Neuron Delivery Catheter recalled for mechanical failure
Recall reason: potential patient injury or death due to retained device portions
No mention of billing, claims, or federal healthcare programs

original_row.text:
SOURCE: FDA Device Recalls

PRODUCT: Penumbra Neuron Delivery Catheter 070,  percutaneous catheter, catalog numbers PND6F0701058, PND6F070956, PND6F0701058M, and PND6F070956M; manufactured by Penumbra, Inc., Alameda, CA.

Indicated for the introduction of interventional devices into the peripheral, coronary, and neuro vasculature.
RECALL REASON: Failure-- product can kink or ovalize, which may result in difficulty in catheter advancement or delivery of other devices and damage to catheter, which could lead to patient injury or death as a result of portions being retained in the patient.
CLASSIFICATION: 
STATUS: Terminated
RECALLING FIRM: Penumbra Inc.
RECALL DATE:

Recall due to failure to correct safety deficiencies in a reasonable timeframe
No mention of Medicare/Medicaid billing or false claims

original_row.text:
SOURCE: FDA Device Recalls

PRODUCT: Baxter Colleague Single Channel Volumetric Infusion Pumps. Baxter Healthcare Corporation, Medication Delivery Division. Product Codes: 2M8151, 2M8161, and 2M9161.
RECALL REASON: The FDA sent a letter to Baxter on April 30, 2010, ordering the company to recall and destroy all models of its Colleague Volumetric Infusion Pumps currently in use in the United States.  FDA determined that this action is necessary, as Baxter has failed to adequately correct, within a reasonable timeframe, the deficiencies in the Colleague pumps still in use. headline: FDA device recall of a Medtronic tactile probe – no evidence of false claims activity

original_row.text:
SOURCE: FDA Device Recalls

PRODUCT: Probe, Tactile, Left, ASM, Long, 
Part #962009S, 
Medtronic Navigation,
Louisville, CO 80027.

Trackable hand held instruments used in spine surgeries for preparation of the pedicle. These instruments are used in conjunction with the Medtronic Navigation StealthStation platform and various software applications.
RECALL REASON: Distal end of tactile probe may break off during use.

headline: FDA device recall for MATRIX Spine System – no evidence of federal healthcare fraud
reason: The record describes a product recall issued by the FDA for labeling corrections. There is no mention of Medicare, Medicaid, or any federal healthcare program billing, nor any indication of false claims, kickbacks, or other fraud types. Without federal program involvement the case falls outside the scope of the False Claims Act and is therefore not viable for a qui tam filing.
key_facts: Recall of MIRS for MATRIX Spine System by Synthes USA HQ, Inc.
Reason: labeling correction following complaints
No mention of billing or reimbursement to federal programs

original_row.text:
SOURCE: FDA Device Recalls

PRODUCT: MIRS for MATRIX Spine System.  Minimally Invasive Reduction Screw (MIRS) for percutaneous instrumentation of the thoracolumbar spine.

The Synthes USS are non-cervial spinal fixation devices intended for posterior pedicle screw fixation (T1-S2/ilium), posterior hook fixation (T1-L5), or anterolateral fixation (T8-L5).
RECALL REASON: Synthes is initiating a Medical Device Labeling Correction following a detailed review of the current labeling in response to reported complaints.  Synthes has identified technique measures and has updated the labeling associated with this system.  The labeling reflects updated technique recommendations and emphasizes the importance of avoiding rod mis-alignment.
CLASSIFICATION: 
STATUS: Terminated
RECALLING FIRM: Synthes USA HQ, Inc.
RECALL DATE:
